Name: Gauls
History: The Gauls were the Celtic tribes of continental Europe. Dominated by a priestly class of Druids, they featured a sophisticated culture of advanced metalworking, agriculture, trade and even road engineering. With heavy infantry and cavalry, Gallic warriors valiantly resisted Caesar's campaign of conquest and Rome's authoritarian rule.

Technologies.Name: Uae Uictos
Technologies.History: Means Woe to the Defeated. It was the words that the Gallic Leader, Brennos, spoke at the Capitol at Rome after they took their plunder.
Technologies.Description: A set amount of metal and food from every structure destroyed or captured.

Technologies.Name: Carnutes
Technologies.History: The Carnutes were druids from Aulercia. They fought when needed, and were largely responsible for turning back the Belgae incursions into Armorica and Aulercia.
Technologies.Description: Gallic druids gain a small melee attack.

CivBonuses.Name: Ardiosmanae
CivBonuses.Description: Enhanced food gained from ranching and farming.

CivBonuses.Name: Deas Celtica
CivBonuses.History: Celtic religion and druidry inspired their warlike mindset.
CivBonuses.Description: Druids increase attack rates of soldiers near them slightly.

TeamBonuses.Name: Druides
TeamBonuses.History: The Druids of the Celts maintained an organized religion that advanced the technology of their people even during wartime.

Structures.Name: Melonas
Structures.History: The Celts developed the first rotary flour mill.
